ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Camelot
ygData.msgSnippet: The time requirements are a little better because there s alot less twinking.  You re not going to find 1st lvl chars with 20th lvl gear.  I haven t had a
ygData.messageBody:
The time requirements are a little better because there's alot less twinking.  You're not going to find 1st lvl chars with 20th lvl gear.  I haven't had a problem completing quests so far because of camping.  The more a mob is camped, the less exp it yields.  This prevents the powerlevelers from sitting in one place for days and killing the same thing over and over.  I'm a casual player as well and don't have time to keep up with the 15 years olds that play EQ for 12 hours a day.  DAoC is much more attuned to how you're progressing, not someone else.
----- Original Message -----
From: Mysliwski Wilk
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, October 25, 2001 10:00 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Camelot

what about time requirements??
EQ demands absolutely all your spare time to enjoy the
game... you know things like you have to camp for a
particular quest item for hours, sometimes days...

Is this needed in DAoC? I played EQ for a while until
I realized it took up almost my whole life...lol.. I
don't wish to start on another MMORPG that's like
that.

I heard AO is pretty good since there's that mission
console thingy that supposedly eliminates camping...

--- wolffe <wolffe@...> wrote:
> I've been playing DAoC as well.  I think you're
> right in that they've built on EQ and are better,
> much in the same way that EQ was better than UO when
> it came out.  I figure that we're all consumers and
> we play the best game.  It's nice to have the
> marketplace competition as each game tries to outdo
> the other.  There's nothing wrong or disloyal in
> switching RPGs, and there will be nothing wrong with
> switching back if/when EQ revamps itself.
>   ----- Original Message -----
>   From: Keith J. Hoover
>   To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
>   Sent: Tuesday, October 23, 2001 9:39 AM
>   Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Camelot
>
>
>   I must say that I too have made the switch,
> haven't touched EQ since DAoC came out.  Dark Age
> has had the benefit of hindsight and learning from
> EQ's mistakes.  They have built upon them.  There is
> less downtime, more character specialization, less
> annoying corpse runs, better graphics, easier
> grouping, and better pvp.  DAoC is better than EQ
> currently, however, to EQ's credit -- Dark Age
> wouldn't be what it is if it hadn't been for EQ's
> experience.
>
>   If you like EQ, I think you'll like Dark Age if
> not as much, perhaps better.  The only drawback is
> that you need a pretty high-end system for smooth
> play (particularly a good graphics card).
>     -----Original Message-----
>     From: LeSamLam@... [mailto:LeSamLam@...]
>     Sent: Tuesday, October 23, 2001 8:14 AM
>     To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
>     Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Camelot
>
>
>     My husband has been playing it.  In fact, after
> a few days, he cancelled his EQ account and is
> solely playing DAoC.  He keeps telling me to try it
> but I tell him I like EQ just fine.  From watching
> him, I can tell I don't wanna play.  BUT he's a
> hardcore gamer and EQ and Solitaire are the only
> games I play.  He says it's like EQ but better.  
>
>     Lena
>
>
>
>       have u guys (anyone I mean) heard of the new
> Dark Ages
>       of Camelot game?? I heard it is like EQ but
> not so
>       long, have any of you plsyed it?? I looked
> around at
>       the stores here in my crappy town & didn't see
> it but
>       I have heard good things.... anyone know?
